documents.document: @nicktmro someone running a Keeping Your Mouth Shut course would make good bank from me.
From nuclear weapons to apartheid, NZers are known for our moral compass and punching above our weight. Our govt must denounce US actions.
@shiflett or in the case of Trump, pick zero.
@Kelchup me too. We can still make noise and support those doing the hard work.
@Kelchup the world is more interconnected than ever before. It's only a matter of years, if that, before the repercussions hit us at home.
@justin_lester car design is amazing. Glad to hear you're OK.
@secvalve Dunning-Kruger says we might not be able to do that. Hard to know what you don't know, too.
@hayleyavw combinations of code paths such you'd need thousands of files to test them all. In that case, focused unit tests fill in the gaps
@hayleyavw if you're able to test all the functionality with black-box then you're fine, but for a complex system there are too many 1/2
@hayleyavw these sort of black-box tests are good, but you might want to also supplement with unit tests if the system you're testing is big
@hayleyavw the longer the better! make them readable so anyone can look at the directory and work out how the code works, it's documentation
@hayleyavw I've done this in a couple of projects, e.g. to test an email message parser. Named the files after what was being tested.
@JoshForde @samjarman @moskoben agreed measuring is important, but you don't have to quantify your work/velocity using agile points though.
@NatDudley turns out we have to relearn them once every three generations
@WellingtonICT "Hmm, look. There's nothing written on this purple post-it either." "Hmm, yeah, you're right."
@amirmohtasebi @samjarman I know a couple of companies that are high in happiness and low in productivity. It's correlated but not strongly.
@samjarman both are management problems
@samjarman in my experience, if devs are working slowly it's either because the process is broken or because they're overfactoring.
@samjarman estimating software build times is hard, and people feel more comfortable using a meaningless number than just using their gut.
@samjarman who cares if you've shipped 100 points if your customers are less happy?
@samjarman super common tho. Metrics like customer satisfaction, customer interaction, support tickets or revenue are actually meaningful.
@samjarman every time you use points to track velocity, a kitten dies. Don't kill the kitties.
@samjarman points are to estimate work in progress/future work. If you're using them retrospectively, You Are Doing It Wrong.
@Pseudony_Ms I'm on season 4. Can report improved feels. Also listening to the west wing podcast.
@aurynn and if you can't, it's because you don't want to, and you should shut the hell up
@aurynn it believes anyone can spend the time necessary to learn a language, learn the codebase, submit a patch, and deal with the politics
@sandofsky Slack's official app on Windows takes 2.5GB with 7 teams loaded. I'm blaming Slack more than Electron.
@Pseudony_Ms or biking in general. Not an expert but it seems NZ got it wrong.
I love this talk. Seriously, if you're a dev, take the time to watch it. It will inform the rest of your career. https://t.co/U47TMSwY5q
@jesslynnrose how do they handle failure? I think this is the canary of culture. You can ask for examples of failure in an interview.
@torshin no probs, we'll flick off the "completely bullshit weather" switch when you come up
@Pseudony_Ms can he do that?
@Pseudony_Ms my only hope is it'd take an act of Congress to defund vaccines (I think?) so hopefully it'll just be a lot of hot air
A white guy (me) explains hiring for diversity with some reasons why it's important for a company's success. https://t.co/xoxEsw2q13
@samjarman I'd watch that talk for the explosions!
@samjarman CFPs have been open for a while now! Are you writing one?
I just got my ticket. It's going to be a fantastic event! https://t.co/XbAsIlunCH
@soundasleep @aurynn I found Chef frustrating and a bit heavy handed too. Happy to share my Ansible recipes for Rails apps!
@eoinkelly isn't that what Twitter is for? Hope you're feeling better soon!
You've reached that point where coding isn't as exciting as it used to be -- what next for you, software developer? https://t.co/IbPc7xMyf9
@sanityinc @kenbier very exciting!
@kenbier @sanityinc because colours were tied to pay bands at Powershop, we didn't make them public, but maybe that's changed recently?
@Pseudony_Ms haha I love the word "squicks"!
@Pseudony_Ms if they were courteous, they'd put down the seat and lid, so you'd still have to lift the lid anyway!
@Phil_Wheeler I think this is a great reason for me to get myself up to Codemania, always been meaning to go!
@Phil_Wheeler hmm, I can definitely see the argument there. If there is a scale, people will put themselves on it based on years. Hmm.
@Phil_Wheeler The spectrum is a way to distance "seniority in age" from "seniority in skill and value", because the latter is what matters.
@Phil_Wheeler maybe I'm not clear; it's crazy that years has anything to do with pay. 1/2
@Phil_Wheeler yeah, with so many factors making up being a good developer, it's hard. But HR needs titles. Do you have any ideas?
Junior? Intermediate? Senior? A proposal for a better way to name software developer roles. https://t.co/s2P1BOsUKd
Excited to publish some more software developer career articles this week.
@Pseudony_Ms hey, there goes the "that's why voters chose Trump as their president" line we were reading about yesterday!
@eoinkelly I don't think my VM has ever reached the jump back operation.
@aurynn she opened my eyes and so many others'. It's a better world because she is in it.
@amirmohtasebi I think that happens for any popular technology. The more mass-market, the lower quality the average build is going to be.
@sanityinc @merxplat not a shabby idea. My Food Bag for flowers, basically.
@merxplat that is a superb idea. I'd so use it.
@Pseudony_Ms the Internet is basically the worst.
@Pseudony_Ms I don't think anyone has. So bizarre.
@sarahmei how would you respond to someone approaching you, assuming it was done in a respectful way?
@nz_sim @Pseudony_Ms Has journalism been reduced to clickbait headlines?
Can confirm: role is awesome. Love building happy teams and shipping? You should apply! https://t.co/KCaxzMbUEx
@sanityinc @mtishy @andrew_jackman yeah, it's ottermatic.
@sanityinc you don't think you're taking it whey too far?
@sanityinc now you're just milking it for all it's worth.
@sanityinc @andrew_jackman can't help it; when I see a bad pun I flounder all about.
@sanityinc @andrew_jackman don't try the fish, it's poisson.
@fauxparse there's this fear of elitism that goes with it, but as long as you're paying a fair price, I think everyone wins.
@fauxparse I found that too. Decided to spend more $ paying people to do the things that were less important for me to do.
@pavsaund @aurynn @cerebralideas I don't understand it well enough to explain in < 140 characters! But I have a draft article in the works.
@sanityinc @missbassethorn @fauxparse @widdnz @mexisme @nz_brian everything in cycles
@jedsoane if you have no luck, try @connectnz on Adelaide Rd. Their repair centre seems to have lots of spare parts & they are super nice.
@missbassethorn @fauxparse @sanityinc @widdnz @mexisme @nz_brian I'd put good money on a nice dumb terminal solution to pop up this year.
@nz_brian @sanityinc @missbassethorn some are suggesting going with a 12" MacBook and using a server for heavy lifting. That's tempting.
@sanityinc @nz_brian @missbassethorn not so important in an office context, but people seem pretty unhappy about the battery life too.
@fauxparse I gave up and went for Spotify/Google Play Music. Both work offline good. GPM allows uploads.
@fauxparse we need to have a talk. Friends don't let friends iTune.
@nz_brian most of the piece rests on the assumption that "business" drives the process. That's not a prerequisite of agile.
@whatthechelz @kellective in any relationship, there had to be a baseline of goodwill. There ain't shit you can do if you don't receive that
@whatthechelz @kellective it's OK to be intolerant of intolerance, and it's OK not to be nice to people who aren't interested in being nice.
@dhh talk about a conflict of interest that is only disclosed at the end of the piece, though...
@whatthechelz I've seen people spend all their energy being friends with pricks, and having none left for their real friends. Or themselves.
@nz_brian while "Lineage" is a better name than "CyanogenMod", I guess they wanted to maintain that awkward mouthfeel.
@fauxparse * also works for backpacks and on crowded buses.
@ericwastl thank you, thank you, thank you for AoC! I enjoyed it so much, and really appreciate the huge amount of work that went into it!
@shoelessgirl hate to say it but I'm with FiL on this one. Although I am aim for a minimum of two allsorts in my mouth at any time.
@shoelessgirl not being a douchebag matters.
@the_o_bot to reference them! I'll write some posts these holidays. Merry Christmas to you too! 2/2
@the_o_bot I don't have anything written up, and even tho there are millions of posts about these topics, I don't like any of them enough 1/
@tanya be sure to leave 2017-Tanya a nice comment to make her feel better.
@fauxparse 'cond' statements also raise/throw/crash if nothing matches, whereas ruby 'case' doesn't.
@shoelessgirl happy 3 months, SH!
@shoelessgirl couriers really are ripe for disruption, they frequently do a horrible job.
@soundasleep better than two hours after boarding closes!
@aurynn so yes. There are always decisions to be made in any complex system, and without structure the loudest and most aggressive will rule
@tanya if you have no luck on twitter, there are a bunch of webpack peoples on the JS.nz slack group.
@samjarman we should just skip webpack next: copypaste libraries and write our code with single-letter variable names all in a single file.
The tech world goes in circles. I'll be happy when we've moved Ï€ radians from this particular trend. https://t.co/yUZsjwOmFL
